title: How to Operate an HVLP Paint Sprayer

steps.headline: Mix the coating material to manufacturer’s instructions and strain material.
Fill the cup with the required amount of material.
steps.description: Fill to no more than 19 mm (3/4") from the top of the cup. DO NOT OVERFILL.

steps.headline: Turn fluid adjusting knob (18) clockwise to prevent fluid needle movement.
Turn spreader valve adjusting knob (23) counterclockwise to fully open.
Trigger the HVLP paint sprayer on and adjust inlet air pressure (for recommended figures see Chart 1 under Parts Replacement) at the gun inlet.
steps.description: (Pressure gauge shown under Accessories is recommended for this).

steps.headline: Turn the fluid adjusting knob counterclockwise until first thread shows.
Test spray.
steps.description: If the finish is too dry, reduce airflow by reducing air inlet pressure.

steps.headline: If finish is too wet, reduce fluid flow by turning fluid adjusting knob (18) clockwise.
steps.description: If atomization is too coarse, increase inlet air pressure. If too fine, reduce inlet pressure. The pattern size can be reduced by turning spreader valve adjusting knob (23) clockwise.

steps.headline: Hold the HVLP paint sprayer perpendicular to surface being sprayed.
steps.description: Arcing or tilting may result in uneven coating. The recommended spray distance is 150-200 mm (6"–8").¨

steps.headline: Spray edges first.
steps.description: Overlap each stroke a minimum of 75%. Move gun at a constant speed.

steps.headline: Always turn off air supply and relieve pressure when gun is not in use.

text: Mix the coating material to manufacturer’s instructions and strain material.  Fill the cup with the required amount of material. Fill to no more than 19 mm (3/4") from the top of the cup. DO NOT OVERFILL. Attach Cup Lid.  Turn fluid adjusting knob (18) clockwise to prevent fluid needle movement.  Turn spreader valve adjusting knob (23) counterclockwise to fully open.  Trigger the HVLP paint sprayer on and adjust inlet air pressure (for recommended figures see Chart 1 under Parts Replacement) at the gun inlet. (Pressure gauge shown under Accessories is recommended for this). Turn the fluid adjusting knob counterclockwise until first thread shows.  Test spray. If the finish is too dry, reduce airflow by reducing air inlet pressure. If finish is too wet, reduce fluid flow by turning fluid adjusting knob (18) clockwise. If atomization is too coarse, increase inlet air pressure. If too fine, reduce inlet pressure. The pattern size can be reduced by turning spreader valve adjusting knob (23) clockwise. Hold the HVLP paint sprayer perpendicular to surface being sprayed. Arcing or tilting may result in uneven coating. The recommended spray distance is 150-200 mm (6"–8").¨ Spray edges first. Overlap each stroke a minimum of 75%. Move gun at a constant speed. Always turn off air supply and relieve pressure when gun is not in use.
